content: "This is the only hustle we know," miners tell the BBC as they try their luck at the site in Springs.

title: US says 'meaningful progress' made as Ukraine talks enter second day
content: The US special envoy struck an optimistic note after the first day of talks in Geneva, but hopes for a breakthrough remain low.

originalTitle: I would scream in my sleep: Women from Syria's Alawite minority tell of kidnap and rape
title: I would scream in my sleep: Women from Syria's Alawite minority tell of kidnap and rape
content: The BBC hears harrowing accounts of assaults appearing to target the sect of former President Assad.

originalTitle: Rescuers search for nine missing skiers after California avalanche
title: Big Snow Trouble in California: Brave Helpers Search for Skiers!
content:
Hello, Friends! Big News from Far Away!

Hello everyone! It’s your kid-friendly news reporter here! I am so happy to share stories with you from all over the world. Today, we have a very important story. It is from a place called California. California is very far away, in a big country named America. It has beautiful mountains, just like our own! Right now, in these big mountains of California, something very big and white has happened. A lot of snow fell down! It was a super, super lot of snow. And it fell down very, very fast.

What is an Avalanche?

When we talk about lots of snow moving fast, we are talking about an "avalanche." Can you say "avalanche"? It sounds like a big sneeze of snow! An avalanche happens when a huge pile of snow slides down a mountain very quickly. Imagine a giant white blanket. Now imagine it suddenly slipping and tumbling down a steep hill! Did you know? Avalanches are a powerful part of nature. They are like a big wave, but made of snow instead of water! They can happen without warning. This is why mountains can be tricky places. Sometimes, too much new snow piles up on top of older snow. The new snow can be very heavy. It can make the snow underneath very weak. Then, the whole big blanket of snow can break free and rush down.

Lots and Lots of Snow!

In the California mountains, they got so much snow! It was an amazing amount. In just one day, about 30 inches of snow fell. That's like putting 30 school rulers one on top of the other! Imagine a pile of snow much taller than you! It was a very big snowfall. This is a huge amount of snow to fall in such a short time. When so much new snow falls, it makes the mountains very tricky. The snow becomes "unstable." This means it can slide easily. Did you know? Snow is actually made of tiny ice crystals. Each crystal is like a little star! When billions of these crystals fall from the sky, they make a big, soft, white blanket. They only fall when the air is super cold. This very heavy snowfall is what made the avalanche happen. It was too much snow for the mountain to hold.

Who are Skiers?

Some people really love to play in the snow! They are called "skiers." Skiers put long, flat pieces of wood or plastic on their feet. We call these "skis." Then they slide down snowy mountains for fun! It's a very exciting and fast sport. It's like flying down the mountain! But it's also a sport where people need to be very, very careful. Skiers go high up into the mountains to find the best, freshest snow to slide on. Sometimes, skiers might be enjoying their time. They might not know that too much snow could make the mountain dangerous. In this sad story, nine people who were skiing are now missing. They were having fun on the mountain when the avalanche happened. Now, their friends and family are very worried about them.

Brave Rescuers to the Rescue!

When people get lost or are in trouble in the mountains, very brave people come to help. These amazing people are called "rescuers." Can you say "rescuers"? They are like real-life superheroes! The rescuers are now working super hard in California. They are looking for the nine skiers who are missing. They disappeared after the big avalanche. The rescuers want to find them. They want to make sure they are safe and warm. These rescuers don't just stand around. They race to the mountains very fast. They know that every minute is important. When someone is lost in the snow, time is precious. Did you know? Rescuers often wear very bright clothes. This helps them to see each other in the big white snowy mountains! It helps them stay safe too.

How Do Rescuers Work?

Rescuers use special tools to help them find people. They might have long poles. They push these poles into the snow. They hope to feel something or someone underneath. They also use special machines. These machines can help them hear things under the snow. Or they can help them see where people might be. And guess what? Some of the bravest helpers have four legs and wagging tails! Yes, clever rescue dogs are working with the people! These dogs have super-duper noses. They can smell things even under very deep snow. Did you know? Rescue dogs are very smart. They train for a long time to learn how to find people. When they find someone, they bark loudly. This tells their human partners that someone is there! They are amazing furry friends and very important helpers. The rescuers are working day and night. It is very, very cold up in the mountains. They must be very strong and brave to do this important job. They work together as a team.

Why is it Dangerous?

Being caught in an avalanche is very scary. The snow is very heavy. It is also very, very cold. It can cover people up completely. It is hard to move or even breathe under so much snow. Also, it gets super cold when you are covered in snow. Your body can get too cold very quickly. This is why the rescuers are working so fast. Every minute counts to help the missing skiers. They are trying their very best. They are using all their skills and all their special tools. Everyone around the world hopes they find the missing people quickly and safely.

Staying Safe in the Mountains

This sad story reminds us that nature can be very powerful. Mountains are beautiful. But they can also be dangerous. When we play in places like mountains, we must always be careful. It's very important to listen to grown-ups. Always stay with a grown-up when you are in a new or wild place. And listen to what they say about safe places to play. Sometimes, it's best to stay away from places where too much snow has fallen. Or where the mountains are too steep. We must always think about safety first! Did you know? Before people go skiing, they often check a "snow report." This report tells them if the snow is safe. It also tells them if there is a risk of an avalanche. This helps them make smart choices.

Sending Our Hopes

From your reporter here in Africa, we are sending all our good thoughts. We think about the brave rescuers. We think about the families of the missing skiers. We hope that the rescuers find everyone safely. It’s a reminder that no matter where we are in the world, people help each other. We also learn to respect the power of nature. Always stay safe, little explorers! Keep learning and stay curious!
summary: Brave rescuers are working hard in California's snowy mountains to find nine skiers who went missing after a big avalanche, which happened because a lot of new snow fell quickly.
whyMatters: This story is important because it shows us how powerful nature can be with a lot of snow, how brave rescuers help people in big trouble, and why it's always good to be very careful and safe when playing in wild places like mountains.

originalTitle: Prestianni denies he racially abused Vinicius
title: Prestianni denies he racially abused Vinicius
content: The Champions League match between Real Madrid and Benfica was halted for 10 minutes, with both sets of players leaving the pitch.

originalTitle: Is VAR any better in the rest of Europe's top leagues?
title: Is VAR any better in the rest of Europe's top leagues?
content: You do not need to look far to find people proclaiming that VAR works fine outside the Premier League. BBC Sport spoke to people across Europe's top leagues to find out.

originalTitle: Real Madrid tie at Benfica halted over Vinicius racism allegation
title: Real Madrid tie at Benfica halted over Vinicius racism allegation
content: Real Madrid's Champions League knockout phase play-off tie at Benfica is halted for 10 minutes after Vinicius Junior reports alleged racist abuse.
